title: Elusive Tiger: Elusive Tiger Rescued and Released Back to the Woods Near Mysuru |
text: Mysuru: A tiger that was spotted near Chikkanahalli on the outskirts of Mysuru has been rescued by foresters in the early hours of Thursday. As per the National Tiger Conservation Authority (NTCA) guidelines, it has been released back into the wild. According to forest department officials, the big cat that was spotted outside the Chikkanahalli Reserve Forest area at the end of Nov had eluded the forest department for over two months. Various teams of the forest department were carrying out a search operation using camera traps, network cameras etc.Officials informed that the tiger is five years old and is healthy. This comes days after a sub-adult tiger was killed near the Mysuru Airport at Mandakalli while crossing the road.According to DCF Basavaraja KN, this tiger was trapped in the newly designed walkthrough cage. “Since Nov 29, 2023, we have been carrying out a search operation for the tiger. Locals were being alerted through the Wildlife Advance Alert System,” he explained.We also published the following articles recentlyPic of deer feeding on trash near reserve forest sparks outrageGarbage dumping near the Peerkankaranai reserve forest has become a major threat to wild deer. A widely shared photograph of deer feeding on garbage highlights the detrimental effects. Efforts to stop the dumping and the potential fatal consequences for wildlife must be taken seriously.107675013Gujarat forest department makes life jackets, buoy rings mandatory at NalsarovarThe state forest department has made life jackets compulsory at Nalsarovar. The Gujarat high court highlighted the absence of safety measures. Chief Justice Sunita Agarwal emphasized the importance of life jackets even in shallow waters. The department has ordered another 500 life jackets.107571078Kanha tiger relocated to Mukundpur SafariA male tiger named Wagh was relocated from Kanha Tiger Reserve to Mukundpur Safari due to concerns about its behavior. After a health examination, Wagh was transported in a specially equipped vehicle.107737986
